data.title: Callstack shows stale frames when first frame is updated
data.body:
Earlier, the callstack would initially update the first frame when stepping, and only show the first frame. Now, it continues to show the rest of the stack when updating the first frame, which seems wrong.

![jun-05-2017 08-16-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/26790567/10b07db6-49c9-11e7-9da7-09d027e43adf.gif)

![jun-05-2017 08-32-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/26790746/addf9298-49c9-11e7-84d0-082abe739a00.gif)

data.title: add remote ftp to tab explorer
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12.2 - OS Version: macos 10.12.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. plz add remote ftp to tab explorer

data.title: Add support for more sequential keys for keybinding

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently we can only use two sequential keys while defining keybindings. E.g., `ctrl-c ctrl-c` works, but `ctrl-c ctrl-c ctrl-c` won't work. This makes it hard to use an Emacs/Spacemacs-like keybinding style. Please increase the max allowed number of sequential keys.

data.title: Scope issue in markdown syntax fenced code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (f977399d58f7b64db35047fafe0c6e59e15f11d5, 2017-06-02T10:45:30.209Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.3|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.8.1|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.15.1|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.18.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.5|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.3.2|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|karyishlight|smlombardi|1.0.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|14.0.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.4.1|
|angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.17|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.13.1|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|2.6.2|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. in a theme, trying to colorize a fenced code block
2. inspecting the code shows a scope of `text.html.markdown markup.fenced_code.block.markdown`, although the part of the inspector that shows the color simply says it's `text` and shows the `text` color of the theme.
3. Adding `text.html.markdown markup.fenced_code.block.markdown` to the theme does not change the color of the code.

![screen shot 2017-06-05 at 10 14 05 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/26787550/6ab8ea82-49d8-11e7-8ba6-0eac3fe1e32a.png)

## Edit

Also seems to apply to any code block in markdown.  It's instead just taking on the syntax coloring of its parent:

![screen shot 2017-06-05 at 10 20 11 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/26787648/c29d4d06-49d8-11e7-9445-9641928bf0be.png)

data.title: cmd+backspace doesn't work for keybinding terminalFocus
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. The `cmd+backspace` key binding works fine for delete all left when edit text focused;
2. I added a key binding for clear all left action when terminal focused, as follows:

```json
[
{ "key": "cmd+backspace",         "command": "deleteAllLeft",
                                     "when": "terminalFocus" }
]
```

Problem: the `cmd+backspace` doesn't work and this key binding only clear one letter as same as single `backspace` behavior. 
Moreover, the `cmd+k` also doesn't work when the terminal focused, and the integrated shell is `/bin/zsh`.

Please let me know if more settings should be provided.

data.title: Emmet css abbreviation not expanded in style block in html file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (f977399d58f7b64db35047fafe0c6e59e15f11d5, 2017-06-02T10:54:04.063Z)

|---|---|---|

|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.8.1|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:
(you can use any css property, this was my first, real-world, live example)
1. Open up https://docs.emmet.io/cheat-sheet/ and search for `d:b`
2. See that emmet usually resolves it to `display: block;`
3. Go to Visual Studio Code
4. Set up your environment:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11234139/26786443/f7769d6a-4a06-11e7-8c98-402b8cd08ec8.png)
5. Type `d:b` and hit `Tab`/`Enter`/...
6. Get this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11234139/26786496/26ef172a-4a07-11e7-8a7f-960c61eaa870.png)
7. Get worried.

data.title: Args not working in tasks.json using - "_runner":"terminal"
webview doesn't recognize svg links
data.body:
If the webview displays a SVG file with links that have command:// hrefs, they aren't recognized by the code because it compares the tag name with "A", but from SVG the tag is always "a". 

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/html/browser/webview-pre.js#L50

data.title: Cannot launch mocha in debug
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

1. Clone repo:
```
git clone https://github.com/EnterpriseJSTutorial/vscode-ts-node-debugging
```

2. Install packages:
```
npm i
```

3. Launch `Current TS Tests File` debug configuration. Error occurs:
```
Cannot launch program 'c:\Dev\vscode-ts-node-debugging\node_modules\.bin_mocha'; setting the 'outDir or outFiles' attribute might help.
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/26781653/5258f764-49f8-11e7-8c6f-ef9d72a4ceca.png)

data.title: Wrong syntax highlighting when escaping quote inside property name of an object literal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de)
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise Service Pack 1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new Javascript file
2. Write the following:

```js
({ 'foo\'': 'bar' })
```

The color of `'foo\` is different from the expected color:

![vs_code_wrong_syntax_highlighting](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12508367/26781110/35033d88-49ed-11e7-9167-9300f03dab0d.png)


Notes:
* This is not specific to Dark+
* It also works when using double quotes:

```js
({ "foo\"": "bar" })
```

data.title: See values in dec or hex in the debugger

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
I'd like to be able to select in which format I see the values of local and watched variables in the debugger. It would be preferred to have a generic setting but be able to change it per variable.

The way that it is now I often need to use a exteral dec-to-hex converter and copy the values from VS Code. Being able to see them in hex directly in the debugger would be a great help!

I mostly debug C/C++ programs but I imagine that this is generic for all languages.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Start debugging
2. Add a watched variable or two.
3. Set a breakpoint and run
4. When stopping at the breakpoint, take a look at the values of the watched and local variables. They are all given in decimal values (except pointers that are hex).

data.title: activationEvents with "*" may not working properly at ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: **Distributor ID**:    `Ubuntu`, **Description**:    Ubuntu `12.04.3 LTS`, **Release**:    `12.04`


Steps to Reproduce:

1. install extension [vscode-git-tags](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=howardzuo.vscode-git-tags)
2. open Command Palette
3. type in `Listing Tags`
4. press ENTER to confirm

Error message `command 'extension.gittags' not found` displayed.

The thing is, my extension works well on other platforms, like `windows`, `osx`. I am thinking it might be caused by the `activationEvents`? May be the extension just not get activated?

data.title: Pressing up or down after switching tabs jumps down in the file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (1.12.2)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have at least one fold active
2. Switch tabs with `ctrl-tab` or `shift-cmd-]`
3. Press down or up arrow

When performing the steps above, _sometimes_ (about 60% of the time) the cursor moves down in the page, at seemingly random distances. Sometimes it moves to the bottom of the page, sometimes just a few lines. This seems to only happen when having a block of code folded. I'm using the Atom layout, and working in Ruby. Is there another shortcut bound to those key presses? I don't think that that's likely as using `ctrl-tab` and `shift-cmd-]` has the same effect.

data.title: Add support template function
data.body: **Such as xxx.vue template** ` `
